New Records: Phil Salt scored 88 runs for England in the match, including a fifty in 38 balls.
England achieved a comprehensive eight-wicket victory over the West Indies, finishing with 181 runs in 17.3 overs.
Key Match Events: Phil Salt and Jonny Bairstow's partnership of 171 runs in 17 overs was the backbone of England's win.
West Indies' batting collapsed multiple times, with key wickets falling at crucial moments.
Adil Rashid took a crucial catch to dismiss Andre Russell, contributing to England's victory.
Pre-Game Insights: England won the toss and decided to bowl, with Jos Buttler optinging for a balanced lineup.
West Indies were seen as a strong contender but faced early pressure from England's bowlers.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler praised the team's discipline and batting performance after the win.
West Indies captain Rovman Powell expressed frustration with the batting display but credited England's bowling.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Daren Sammy National Cricket Stadium in St Lucia.
The game was a crucial one for both teams in their respective groups in the T20 World Cup.
